recipes.title: Teriyaki Sirloin Kabobs

winePairing.pairingText: Steak works really well with Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Pinot Noir. After all, beef and red wine are a classic combination. Generally, leaner steaks go well with light or medium-bodied reds, such as pinot noir or merlot, while fattier steaks can handle a bold red, such as cabernet sauvingnon. The Sterling Vineyards Merlot with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 29 dollars per bottle.

recipes.instructions: Place the sirloin in a resealable plastic bag or container.Place the marinade ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until combined.Set aside and allow to cool.Pour about 3/4 of the marinade over the meat and set the rest aside for basting later.Cover the meat and place in the refrigerator to marinate for 6 - 24 hours.If using wooden skewers, allow them to soak in water for at least 10 minutes.Preheat your grill to medium-high heatSkewer the meat, pineapple, peppers and onions and place on the grill.Baste with the extra teriyaki sauceCook the skewers, turning as needed, for about 8-10 minutes or until the meat is cooked to your liking and the vegetables are tender.Remove, serve, and Enjoy

steps.step: Place the sirloin in a resealable plastic bag or container.
Place the marinade ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until combined.Set aside and allow to cool.

Pour about 3/4 of the marinade over the meat and set the rest aside for basting later.Cover the meat and place in the refrigerator to marinate for 6 - 24 hours.If using wooden skewers, allow them to soak in water for at least 10 minutes.Preheat your grill to medium-high heat
Skewer the meat, pineapple, peppers and onions and place on the grill.Baste with the extra teriyaki sauce
Cook the skewers, turning as needed, for about 8-10 minutes or until the meat is cooked to your liking and the vegetables are tender.
